"Silky silk floss", Yan Shi's ancient note: "The cocoon is stained, the clear one is cotton, and the thick one is floc. Nowadays, the new one is cotton, so the one is floc." For example, "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Bamboo Slips. "Closed Diagnosis Style" Jan. 81-82: "Yi Yiyu February is this garment, fifty feet, silk lining, silk flocculent Yujin [Zhuang 糸] (installation), Miao Zhen five feet edge and temple (pure)." The full sentence is translated as: This dress made by B in February of this year is made of fifty feet, made of silk, filled with five catties of cotton wool, and used five feet of Miao Zhuo for trim. Another example is "Historical Records. "Biography of the Huns": "As a matter of fact, the Han Dynasty often sent the owner of the lords to provide good food to the Xiongnu in order to make peace, and the Huns would not disturb the border."

" Fu " is an extension of something that is white and soft like a floc. Such as "Qi Min Yao Shu. "Miscellaneous": "Three days and removal, pick moxa and catkins." Luo Bin Wang of the Tang Dynasty "Chou Xi Pian": "Shangyuan frequently flies through catkins, and Zhongyuan sees plum blossoms a few times."

" Su " means the silk, cotton, etc. filled in the quilt. Such as "Han Shu. "The wrong biography of Yan Angpi" "Today Hu Yiqu's barbarians belong to the returnees, and thousands of them have the same dietary skills as the Xiongnu. They can be given strong armor and fleece, strong bows and arrows, and good riding for the border county. ." It is also used as a verb, which means to fill clothes. For example, the fourth part of Li Bai's "Midnight Wu Ge" in the Tang Dynasty: "Ming dynasty's post ambassador, surrendering robe overnight."

" Xu " means blending and mixing. "Jade articles. "Itobe": "Su, harmonize food." Such as "Book of Rites. "Qu Lishang" "Wuxuqi", Zheng Xuan's note: "xu, still tune also." Kong Yingda Shu: "xu, said that the tableware is mixed with salt and plum." Tang Dynasty Bai Juyi "and 40 rhyme on March 30 〉: "Mixed fish with mustard sauce, water sunflower salted black bean flakes."

" Xu " also means continuous, repetitive, and more to describe words that are verbose. Such as Feng Menglong in the Ming Dynasty "Jing Shi Tong Yan. "Jin Ming Chi and Wu Qing Every Love Love": "Sleep till dawn, get up to freshen up, eat some breakfast, the couple chattering, and refuse to let go." Qing Dynasty Ji Xiaolan, "Yuewei Cottage Notes. humanum_full_description:
從「糸」，「如」聲。本義是質量較差的絲綿。《說文》：「絮，敝綿也。从糸，如聲。」朱駿聲《說文通訓定聲》：「好者為緜，惡者為絮。」《急就篇》「絳緹絓紬絲絮綿」，顏師古注：「漬繭擘之，清者為緜，麤者為絮。今則謂新者為綿，故者為絮。」例子如《睡虎地秦簡．封診式》簡81-82：「乙以迺二月為此衣，五十尺，帛裏，絲絮于斤[莊糸]（裝），繆繒五尺緣及殿（純）。」全句翻譯為：乙在本年二月做的這件衣服，用料五十尺，用帛做裏，裝了綿絮五斤，用繆繒五尺做鑲邊。又如《史記．匈奴列傳》：「故約，漢常遣翁主，給繒絮食物有品，以和親，而匈奴亦不擾邊。」

　　「絮」引申表示像絮一樣白色的、輕柔的東西。如《齊民要術．雜說》：「三日及上除，採艾及柳絮。」唐代駱賓王〈疇昔篇〉：「上苑頻經柳絮飛，中園幾見梅花落。」

　　「絮」表示衣被裡填充的絲綿、棉花等。如《漢書．爰盎鼂錯傳》「今降胡義渠蠻夷之屬來歸誼者，其眾數千，飲食長技與匈奴同，可賜之堅甲絮衣，勁弓利矢，益以邊郡之良騎。」又作動詞，表示填充衣被。如唐代李白〈子夜吳歌〉之四：「明朝驛使發，一夜絮征袍。」

　　「絮」表示調和、調拌。《玉篇．糸部》：「絮，調和食也。」如《禮記．曲禮上》「毋絮羮」，鄭玄注：「絮，猶調也。」孔穎達疏：「絮，謂就食器中調和鹽梅也。」唐代白居易〈和三月三十日四十韻〉：「魚膾芥醬調，水葵鹽豉絮。」

　　「絮」還表示連續不斷、重複，多形容說話囉嗦。如明代馮夢龍《警世通言．金明池吳清逢愛愛》：「睡到天明，起來梳洗，喫些早飯，兩口兒絮絮叨叨，不肯放手。」清代紀曉嵐《閱微草堂筆記．灤陽消夏錄六》：「其人絮絮言家務得失，媼婢善惡，皆委曲周至。」

絮字的基本解释

絮
xù
棉花的纤维：棉絮。被絮。
古代指丝的纤维，特指熟丝。
像棉絮的东西：花絮。芦絮。柳絮。
在衣被等物里铺棉花、丝绵等：絮被子。絮棉袄。
连续重复，惹人厌烦：絮叨。絮烦。絮聒。絮絮叨叨。

絮字的汉语字典释义

[①]［xù］
［《廣韻》息據切，去御，心。］
(1)粗丝绵。
(2)弹松的棉花。
(3)称白色易扬而轻柔似絮者。
(4)在衣、被等物内铺进丝绵或棉絮等。
(5)古代的一种头巾。
(6)优柔寡断。
(7)引申为噜苏。
(8)腻烦。
[②]［chù］
［《廣韻》抽據切，去御，徹。］
调拌；调制。
[③]［nǜ］
［《廣韻》尼據切，去御，娘。］
姓。汉有絮舜。见《汉书·张敞传》。
